Functions
UART001.c File Reference

UART001 App provides non reentrant APIs for higher level Apps which can be used in a Non -RTOS environment. Limitations of Simple UART App a) Read/Write functions are non reentrant. b) No support for DMA mode. More...

Detailed Description

UART001 App provides non reentrant APIs for higher level Apps which can be used in a Non -RTOS environment. Limitations of Simple UART App a) Read/Write functions are non reentrant. b) No support for DMA mode.

Definition in file UART001.c.

#include <DAVE3.h>

Functions

void UART001_lInit (const UART001_HandleType *Handle)
void UART001_Init (void)
 Initializes all the UART channel registers consumed by UART001 App. All the UART001 App instances are configured as per the UI configuration.
void UART001_DeInit (const UART001_HandleType *Handle)
 Function provided to reset the App to default values.
status_t UART001_Configure (const UART001_HandleType *Handle, uint32_t BaudRate, UART_ParityType Parity, UART_StopBitType Stopbit)
 Function which allows changing of baudrate,parity & stop bit configuration at run time.
uint32_t UART001_ReadDataMultiple (const UART001_HandleType *Handle, uint16_t *DataPtr, uint32_t Count)
 This function reads out the content of the USIC receive FIFO Buffer until there is data in the buffer or reached the input count value. Note: Fifo trigger limit should be adjusted manually to read required amount of data.
uint32_t UART001_WriteDataMultiple (const UART001_HandleType *Handle, uint16_t *DataPtr, uint32_t Count)
 This function writes out a word to the USIC FIFO transmit buffer register until the FIFO buffer is full or reached the Count value. Note: Fifo trigger limit should be adjusted manually to transmit to transmit required amount of data.
status_t UART001_GetFlagStatus (const UART001_HandleType *Handle, UART001_FlagStatusType Flag)
 The function is used to get the event flag status specified. It returns UART_SET if the corresponding flag is set else otherwise.
void UART001_ClearFlag (const UART001_HandleType *Handle, UART001_FlagStatusType Flag)
 This function clears the specified event flag status.

Function Documentation

void UART001_ClearFlag ( const UART001_HandleType *  Handle,
UART001_FlagStatusType  Flag 
)

This function clears the specified event flag status.

Parameters:
[in]HandleUSIC device handle
[in]FlagUART Flag which needs to be cleared
Returns:
None

Reentrant: NO


Example:
UART001_Handle0 is a global structure of type UART001_HandleType which will be configured in UART001_Conf.c file using UI parameters. 

  #include <DAVE3.h>
 
  int main(void)
  {
    uint32_t Status = UART001_ERROR;
    uint16_t Data;
    // Initializes Apps configurations ...
    DAVE_Init();
    Status = UART001_Configure( &UART001_Handle0,19200,UART_PARITY_EVEN,UART_ONE_STOPBIT);
    if(Status == DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
    {
      // Uart channel reconfiguration successful
      //wait till standard receive buffer event is occurred
      while(!(UART001_GetFlagStatus(&UART001_Handle0,UART001_FIFO_STD_RECV_BUF_FLAG)))
      {}
      //Read Receive FIFO buffer till the buffer is empty
      Data = UART001_ReadData(UART001_Handle0);
      UART001_ClearFlag(&UART001_Handle0,UART001_FIFO_STD_RECV_BUF_FLAG);
      if(Data == 0x43)
      {
         //Checking the data received
      }
    }
    // ... infinite loop ...
    while(1)
    {
 
    }
  }

status_t UART001_Configure ( const UART001_HandleType *  Handle,
uint32_t  BaudRate,
UART_ParityType  Parity,
UART_StopBitType  Stopbit 
)

Function which allows changing of baudrate,parity & stop bit configuration at run time.

Parameters:
[in]HandleUSIC device handle
[in]BaudRateDesired Baud Rate in Bauds
[in]ParityDesired Parity
[in]StopbitDesired no of Stop bit(s)
Returns:
status
DAVEApp_SUCCESS : for success.
UART001_ERROR : for failure case.
UART001_BUSY : UART channel is busy.

Reentrant: NO


Example:
UART001_Handle0 is a global structure of type UART001_HandleType which will be configured in UART001_Conf.c file using UI parameters. 

  #include <DAVE3.h>

  int main(void)
  {
    uint32_t Status = UART001_ERROR;
    // ... Initializes Apps configurations ...
    DAVE_Init();
    Status = UART001_Configure( &UART001_Handle0,19200,UART_PARITY_EVEN,UART_ONE_STOPBIT);
    if(Status == DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
    {
        // Uart channel reconfiguration successful 
    }
    // ... infinite loop ...
    while(1)
    {

    }
  }

status_t UART001_GetFlagStatus ( const UART001_HandleType *  Handle,
UART001_FlagStatusType  Flag 
)

The function is used to get the event flag status specified. It returns UART_SET if the corresponding flag is set else otherwise.

Parameters:
[in]HandleUSIC device handle
[in]FlagUART Flag which needs to be checked
Returns:
status_t
UART_SET : indicates Flag is set.
UART_RESET : indicates Flag is reset.

Reentrant: NO


Example:
UART001_Handle0 is a global structure of type UART001_HandleType which will be configured in UART001_Conf.c file using UI parameters. 

  #include <DAVE3.h>
 
  int main(void)
  {
    uint32_t Status = UART001_ERROR;
    uint16_t Data;
    // Initializes Apps configurations ...
    DAVE_Init();
    Status = UART001_Configure( &UART001_Handle0,19200,UART_PARITY_EVEN,UART_ONE_STOPBIT);
    if(Status == DAVEApp_SUCCESS)
    {
      // Uart channel reconfiguration successful
      //wait till standard receive buffer event is occurred
      while(!(UART001_GetFlagStatus(&UART001_Handle0,UART001_FIFO_STD_RECV_BUF_FLAG)))
      {}
      //Read Receive FIFO buffer till the buffer is empty
      Data = UART001_ReadData(UART001_Handle0);
      UART001_ClearFlag(&UART001_Handle0,UART001_FIFO_STD_RECV_BUF_FLAG);
      if(Data == 0x43)
      {
         //Checking the data received
      }
    }
    // ... infinite loop ...
    while(1)
    {
 
    }
  }

uint32_t UART001_ReadDataMultiple ( const UART001_HandleType *  Handle,
uint16_t *  DataPtr,
uint32_t  Count 
)

This function reads out the content of the USIC receive FIFO Buffer until there is data in the buffer or reached the input count value. Note: Fifo trigger limit should be adjusted manually to read required amount of data.

Parameters:
[in]HandleUSIC device handle
[out]DataPtrPointer to data
[in]CountTotal no of words to be read.
Returns:
uint32_t Number of data read from FIFO register

Reentrant: NO

Note: Fifo trigger limit should be adjusted manually in the UI based on the number of data's to be buffered.


Example:
UART001_Handle0 is a global structure of type UART001_HandleType which will be configured in UART001_Conf.c file using UI parameters. 

 #include <DAVE3.h>

 uint16_t Readdata[11];
 int main(void)
 {

  DAVE_Init();
  while(1);
  return 0;
 }

  void RecvFifoHandler()
 {
         UART001_ReadDataMultiple(&UART001_Handle0,Readdata,11);
 }


Definition at line 379 of file UART001.c.

References UART001_FUN_ENTRY, UART001_FUN_EXIT, UART001_HandleType::UartRegs, and USIC_ubIsRxFIFOempty.

uint32_t UART001_WriteDataMultiple ( const UART001_HandleType *  Handle,
uint16_t *  DataPtr,
uint32_t  Count 
)

This function writes out a word to the USIC FIFO transmit buffer register until the FIFO buffer is full or reached the Count value. Note: Fifo trigger limit should be adjusted manually to transmit to transmit required amount of data.

Reentrant : No

Parameters:
[in]HandleUSIC device handle
[in]DataPtrPointer to data
[in]CountTotal no of words to be transmitted.
Returns:
uint32_t Number of data written to buffer

Reentrant: NO

Note: Fifo trigger limit should be adjusted manually in the UI based on the number of data's to be buffered.


Example:
UART001_Handle0 is a global structure of type UART001_HandleType which will be configured in UART001_Conf.c file using UI parameters. 

 #include <DAVE3.h>
 int main(void)
 {
  uint32_t status = 0;
  uint16_t Data[11] = {0x48,0x45,0x4C,0x4C,0x4F,0x20,0x57,0x4F,0x52,0x4C,0x44};
  DAVE_Init();
  // Send hello world to PC hyper terminal
  status = UART001_WriteDataMultiple(&UART001_Handle0,Data,11);
  if(status == 11)
  {
         //data transmitted
  }
  while(1);
  return 0;
 }
